contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Zafar Iqbal (disambiguation)}} {{MedalTop}} {{MedalSport|Men's [[Field hockey at the Summer Olympics|field hockey]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1980 Summer Olympics|1980 Moscow]]|[[Field hockey at the 1980 Summer Olympics|Team]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Zafar Iqbal''' (born June 20, 1956) is an Indian [[field hockey]] player. He wore Indian blue jersey number 11. ==Professional career== Iqbal was a member of the [[1980 Summer Olympics]] field hockey team that won the last Olympic Gold Medal for India. He has captained Indian squad in various international events, among them being [[Asian Games]], in 1982 and 1983 [[Hockey Champions Trophy|Champions Trophy]], and the [[1984 Summer Olympics]]. Iqbal is remembered for a strong attack as well as for missing a goal, in front of an open goal against West Germany, that would have placed India a semifinal spot in the 1984 Olympics. Iqbal was awarded the [[Arjuna Award]], the highest award given in sports by India.<ref>[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/iq/zafar-iqbal-1.html Zafar Iqbal Biography and Statistics - Olympics at Sports-Reference.com]</ref> He has served as Chief National Coach for Indian hockey from early 1993 to October 1994. Iqbal currently works as manager for [[Indian Airlines]] and is a National selector for Indian hockey team.<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/2009/02/08/stories/2009020856611700.htm The Hindu : Sport : India sets up title clash with the Netherlands]</ref>He was awarded PadmaShri Award in 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.pib.nic.in/newsite/erelease.aspx?relid=79881|title= Padma Awards|publisher=pib|date= January 27, 2013 |accessdate= January 27, 2013 }}</ref> ==See also== *[[List of Indian hockey captains in Olympics]] *[[Field hockey in India]] *[[India national field hockey team]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://sports.indiatimes.com/We_should_not_allow_the_game_to_die/articleshow/2281069.cms IndiaTimes Sports interview] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Iqbal, Zafar | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Field hockey player | DATE OF BIRTH = June 20, 1956 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iqbal, Zafar}} [[Category:Indian field hockey players]] [[Category:Olympic field hockey players of India]] [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Olympic gold medalists for India]] [[Category:People from Aligarh]] [[Category:Aligarh Muslim University alumni]] [[Category:Recipients of the Arjuna Award]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in field hockey]]
